name: digdugz
text: That is stone cold.

name: zem
text:
panels 5-7

gold

name: atticusonline
text: I'm a big fan of panels 1-15

name: bozendoka
text:
Panel 9: He was in the middle of putting that shirt on and got so worked up that he had to stop and write the letter.

Only then was he calm enough to knot his tie.

name: epicurus
text: To me, this whole strip is basically just panel #10 and the rest is a prologue and epilogue.

name: spinynorman
text: Somewhere, Bruce Springsteen is scrambling to set Beef's letter to a pained, folksy ballad.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: A comment left by scorpio_nadir was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by drago25, jezebel, zaer, wingspan, SurelySmack, Satyr, Rakadin)

name: fablesandblues
text: I disagree with you about the boss, but couldn't Mr. Springsteen eat a bag of dick anywhere? The point of a bag is portability .

name: scorpio_nadir
text: A comment left by scorpio_nadir was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Norsef, mashisoyo, jezebel)

name: zem
text: this comment owns!

name: 1000hz
text:
Love letter from a snake.

It doesn't get any better than this, people.

name: heavymetaljesus
text: I was just thinking that.

name: 1000hz
text: This ticket is causing Beef hell of smackers.

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
the misspelling of "Ford Galaxie" is a nice added slap.

and i gess anyone who wants to get authentic 'beef plates should get "NEV 046".

name: tellumo
text: Which will be really hard because California hasn't issued regular plates with three letters and three numbers since around 1979 . . .

name: alejandroadam
text: they still do this in Nevada (the NEV part also supports this idea in my head even though that makes little sence) also it used to be a common scam for Californians to get Nev. plates and Licence. because it involved alot of easily exploitible loopholes. but nowadays, not so much.

name: tellumo
text: True. Also, it is a pre-'79 vehicle, so it could have the original plates.

name: connellingus
text: I don't see why they couldn't issue that as a vanity plate.

name: apocowarg
text: They don't issue vanity plates that look like regular plates in most states as it can cause some confusion. I work at a DMV in Vermont and we issue regular plates with the three letters followed by three numbers combination. We restrict vanity plates to only two numbers regardless of sequencing to help cops call in plates and our mail processing unit to sort out applications.

name: connellingus
text: Clearly the Achewood police aren't fans of Peel-Out Summer .

name: stuart
text: The Department of Car Police.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: aperson
text: Beef owns a fax, but no falcon.

name: tellumo
text: I always thought that was a printer . . .

name: nigelchaos
text: It is a fax.. alt-text confirms.

name: mastronaut
text: How does the alt text confirm its a fax? it says "I guess he's just going to hand the letter to the judge and stand there?"

name: nigelchaos
text: Ha. I looked back at that and.. damn. I dunno what the hell I was thinking. think I was going for "it's not a fax".. drinking and typing don't mix.

name: rowboat
text: Am I the only one who immediately assumed that it was one of those machines that automatically folds a letter into perfect thirds?

name: bixschmix
text: None of those machines still exist. They were all repurposed to roll perfect joints before the venture imploded.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: all one of them.

name: rogergs
text: Beef knows exactly enough Nation of Islam lingo, filtered through the two Public Enemy CDs he owns, to call a cop a "snake."

name: squaralina
text: A comment left by squaralina was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by instantkarma, _cheesekayke, Darthemed)

name: goosey
text: Even though the first few characters deny it, I do like to imagine the cut-off text of the ticket to be 'that is terrible'.

name: apocowarg
text: the determination with which roast beef knots his tie is awe-inspiring.

name: dasilodavi
text: I like how the alt text acknowledges that this is a plan that may not work.

name: molesticide
text: and that chris has his own doubts about its validity.

name: closefriend
text: That letter would make a great blues song. All you need is Bob Dylan to sing it.

name: goatmasterflash
text: Not me. I do not need Bob Dylan to sing this. Bob Dylan is an OK guy, but if he your go-to for blues, you've missed out on things.

name: cailetshadow
text: Roast Beef does not fight for himself very well, but at least he not-fights with grim determination.

name: happycat
text: It wasn't until this strip that I saw a major link between Beef and Charles Bukowski, but now its kind of hard not to see it.

name: nokococo
text: All I could think while sitting through 6 hours of Defensive Driving was: Man I wish I could contest this like Beef.

name: buttermoths
text:
"Do you know what a LOVE LETTER is, motherfucker?! It's a parking ticket from a fucking SNAKE!"
-Frank Booth, kinda.

name: massialot
text: Beef appears to still be using an Apple Stylewriter. Good for him.

name: catgrl131
text: Talk about a computer which basically has AIDS.

name: achilleselbow
text: That is the most polite parking ticket I've ever seen.

name: direhaggis
text: It looks as if the parking sign is somehow literally answering Beef's question. I mean he's looking straight at the thing, his head is turned. That parking sign is a dick. Needs some manners from the snakes.

name: rockstarsatemy
text: this gets a five just for being a ford galaxy.

name: fixipoo
text: Philippe was the officer.

name: mrectomy
text: Panels 5-7 made me laugh so hard my boss heard and came over, telling me to quit screwing around.

name: mustakrakesh
text: You fight the syatem and the system WILL fight back.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: somewhere in the Ford Galaxy...

name: puguglypress
text: He's so much shorter than the doorknob! One of those all-too-rare reminders of what he is.

name: niraj
text: The overly polite officer's remarks section always makes me laugh

name: lolsworth
text: The parking ticket is so regretful. "We are very sorry, but you should not park here."
